GlossaryCacheEntry.Definition: The person or group who will receive the email; entered in the "To," "Cc," or "Bcc" fields.
The action of creating a new email message within Gmail.
A symbol in the Gmail compose window used to attach files to an email.
A free email service provided by Google that allows users to send, receive, and organize emails.
The main section of the email where the message content is written.
A field to send a copy of the email to additional recipients without disclosing their addresses to others.
A file (e.g., document, image, video) included with an email for the recipient to download.
A field to send a copy of the email to additional recipients who are visible to all recipients.
A saved but unsent email that can be edited and sent later.
A button used to send the composed email to the specified recipients.
The primary folder in Gmail where received emails are stored.
A temporary folder where emails are stored before being successfully sent.
An option to respond directly to a received email.
An option to send a received email to a new recipient.
A prewritten text, often containing contact details or a sign-off, automatically appended to emails.
The process of reviewing and correcting an email before sending it.
Features in Gmail to style text, such as bold, italics, underlining, or changing font and color.
A tool in Gmail to find specific emails based on keywords, senders, or subjects.
A set of tools provided in the email composition window with multiple options such as adding attachments, text formating, adding signatures, and so on.
